headline: McConnell: No space in GOP for 'white supremacists or anti-Semitism' after two House Republicans attend in white nationalist's conferene
author: Jonathan Edwards and Mariana Alfaro
sentences:
Washington Post
Washington - Senate Minority Leader Mitch McConnell, R-Ky., said Monday that there is no place in the Republican Party for "white supremacists or anti-Semitism" after two House Republicans participated in a conference organized by a white nationalist who encouraged a chant supporting Russian President Vladimir Putin.

McConnell issued a statement in response to reports that Reps. Marjorie Taylor Greene of Georgia and Paul Gosar of Arizona addressed the America First Political Action Conference (AFPAC) in Orlando, Fla.
The event was organized by Nicholas Fuentes.
